title: [K-12] Andragogical Design of Hybrid Learning Spaces: Integrating Digital Technology and Socio-Material Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of higher education environments, experience with digital technology applications, and self-directed learning ability
context.additional_context: Learners flexibly study in a mobile environment using personal devices (BYOD), experiencing hybrid learning spaces through social interaction and digital tool integration.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze andragogical learning designs that connect digital technologies (DT) with socio-material spaces in hybrid environments.
Learners can establish and execute self-directed learning plans using mobile microlearning tools.
Learners can diagnose multidirectional interactions (connectivity, embodiment, materiality) in hybrid learning spaces according to evaluation criteria.

resources: Mobile learning platform (LMS), digital collaboration tools (Miro, Padlet), survey tools (Google Forms), hybrid space design templates

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
